quest.name: Like a Crate to Water
journal:
Maru is in need of a pair of legs swift both on land and off.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
objectives: Deliver the crates to the troubled Rider.

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are─an' just when I'd given up hope of findin' you. I've received word of a delivery gone awry near the Great Work, and was dreadin' havin' to go myself...

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: This task requires some skill in swimmin', you see, and while I can manage to stay afloat, we Arkasodara ain't much known for our grace in the water. I resigned myself to a few lost crates, but now my prospects are lookin' brighter.

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: What do you say? If you don't mind a dip in the waters nearby, head to the Great Work and speak to the Rider there. I reckon he shouldn't be hard to find.

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: Oh divinities, oh no... Oh! Did Maru send you? Please tell me Maru sent you. My crates went flyin' into the water, and the current's gonna drag 'em clear away before long...

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: I managed to pick up a few that've washed up ashore, but there's three out there that I ain't reachin' unless I up and turn into a hippo myself. If you could haul those back here, we'll be right as rain.

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: I was sure I'd have to either drown or be struck down by Trna's “disappointed” face...but now that you're here, I can breathe easy. That is, so long as you catch those crates before they're swept away...

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: Did you find the goods? Those waves are so rough, I hope nothin's damaged...

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you, thank you! The delivery was going smoothly as any other till somethin' spooked my hippo─poor dear toppled the cart right over in their excitement.

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: I was lucky enough not to catch a hoof to the trunk, so I grabbed what I could, but the rest went tumblin' into the waters. I shudder to think what would've happened if I had to brave the sea myself...

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: Sweet Sisters, I can feel the clammy hands of death clawin' at my lungs just thinkin' about it! I reckon a bit of slow an' steady crate stackin' would do me good just about now, so why don't you go ahead an' tell Maru I won't be long?

dialogue.name: DELIVERER04576
dialogue.text: Truth be told, the ocean an' I never really got along. Thanks to you, it can stay that way! I'll make sure the shipment is all in place─you go ahead an' tell Maru I'll be completin' my delivery soon.

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Was the situation as dire as the Rider made it out to be?

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: I see... Looks like we're in your debt once again. I can't help but wonder what got into that hippo, though... This all happened 'round about the Great Work, you say?

dialogue.name: MARU
dialogue.text: Might've been some particularly fragrant concoction brewed by one of the alchemists... Or maybe it was somethin' else entirely. Either way, we'd do well to find out the cause before this happens again...
